intro: Viscaria × media, commonly known as the hybrid carnation, is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its showy, colorful blooms that come in a variety of shades. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and serrated leaves. It is well-suited for gardens and landscapes due to its hardiness and ability to thrive in a range of soil conditions. Viscaria × media is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular in floral arrangements.
